Split 252-lines-long method with sub-methods. At least on Android 1.5, any call to this method was crashing because methods cannot generate more than 65535 bytecodes. Now it is working. See http://stackoverflow.com/q/8335933

Issue 692: Prevent creation of deck with ':' in name

The special characters : / and \ are not allowed in deck names because
they are not valid on some file systems.

Prevent the user for inputting any of these while creating a new deck.

Tests for Utils.removeInvalidDeckNameCharacters.

Also fix the case where its argument may be null.
Solved NPE described in issue 923 by not executing if null

Issue 874: card sorting not working.

There was a mismatch between the columns and their indices in the query
used to construct the set of cards used by the card editor.

Extract that logic into a separate class and add tests to guarantee
consistency.

Also fix a null pointer exception when the SQL query fails to execute.
Default font description clarified following Kostas advice on forum

Issue 925: Action Bar missing on Honeycomb+ when using White theme.

Re-organizes the styles to introduce a base theme which can then be used
to behave differently on Honeycomb+, without having to copy the actual
styles.
partial fix for issue 564 - card browser text too small on tablets
issue 926 - added orientation attribute=black|white to [fen] tag
Repaired some bugs. Changed settings style.

Issue 937: no menu button during review on galaxy nexus

The new base themes should be used for all devices running Honeycomb+
not just tablets. ICS phones also use the Holo themes, which makes sure
there is a menu button on screen.
fix for long filenames of decks (fix for issue 121)

Issue 630: Card counts disappear after opening the options menu

We were doing something quite complex to disable the top bar when the
menu is opened. However, this causes a number of issues with Honeycomb+
since 'onPrepareOptionsMenu' may be called before the menu is actually
opened.

Instead of splitting the logic into two different paths (pre- and post-
Honeycomb) I actually removed this logic and I tested it on Donut and
Gingerbread. It is working well on both.

Issue 937: no menu button during review on galaxy nexus

Restores the previous logic for adding the right items to the menu and
fix the underlying problem.

The problem was that we do not call 'invalidateOptionsMenu()' when the
current card changes. This means that while it is initially loading, we
set the options menu to be hidden, and we never actually change it
contents.

Fix for crash on Donut.

One of the pieces used for animation was executed on Donut, which is
however incompatible with it and therefore crashes on going back from
the review screen.

Issue 630: Card counts disappear after opening the options menu

We were doing something quite complex to disable the top bar when the
menu is opened. However, this causes a number of issues with Honeycomb+
since 'onPrepareOptionsMenu' may be called before the menu is actually
opened.

Instead of splitting the logic into two different paths (pre- and post-
Honeycomb) I actually removed this logic.

I tested it on Donut and Gingerbread and it works fine without it.

This was introduced by:
https://github.com/flerda/Anki-Android/commit/681eda513f87074694e8df81e6dc49b21f90c41e
in order to force showing the notification area.

However, this causes flickering which is only partially fixed by the
existing implementation. Since it is still possible to switch to the
home screen to check the notifications, I think it is okay to remove it.

If we wanted a quick way to see the notification, I would suggest having
some way to toggle fullscreen from the options menu instead.
